result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   

Matter is dismissed and read into cases:  14CM1889, 15CM1358 & 15CM1760
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-10-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery and pretrial offers on all cases.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 01-13-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint, unless his mother and step father consent in writing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.

For Non-Appearance.
Under Lying Case 14CM1889 (Battery and D.C.).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins in court.   
Defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio did not appear. 
Case called along with:  14CM1889 & 15CM104
  
Defendant notified our office that he would be unable to appear today (stated he was in the hospital with kidney stones).
Atty. Perkins stated she has had no contact with her client since February.
Defendant has a new case 15CM1358 - that was just filed on 07/27/15 and went out on a warrant.

Court orders a Warrant be issued.
Bail is revoked and forfeited.
Cash bail set @
